content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a one row table with four columns of data. The data in the table are as follows. f of 1, equals 4. f prime of 1, equals negative 2. g of 3, equals 7. g prime of 3, equals 1." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0em" columnwidth="6em 6em 6em 6em" equalrows="false" frame="solid" framespacing="0em 1em" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="0em" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mtd><mtd><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></mtd><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The point <math alttext="with coordinates 1 comma 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> lies on the curve in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane given by the equation <math alttext="f of x, times, g of y, equals 24 plus x, plus y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>24</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a differentiable function of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a differentiable function of <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Selected values of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="f prime" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="g prime" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> are given in the table above. What is the value of <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> at the point <math alttext="with coordinates 1 comma 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
